description: Visual puzzles involving shape fitting, puzzle completion, perspective views (top/side/front), and pattern matching with tiles.

concepts.name: 3D to 2D Projection
concepts.description: Identifying what a 3D shape looks like from different viewing angles (top, front, side)
common_misconceptions: Mixing up top and side views
question_patterns: What does this 3D shape look like from above?
example_stems: This cube arrangement shows [shape]. What is the view from the front?
Looking down at this structure, which outline do you see?

concepts.name: 2D to 3D Construction
concepts.description: Given 2D views, determining what 3D shape they represent
question_patterns: Given these views, which 3D shape is shown?
Which structure has these top, front, and side views?
example_stems: The top view is [shape], front view is [shape]. Which 3D structure is this?
Combining these three views, how many cubes are in the structure?

concepts.name: Cube Counting
concepts.description: Counting the number of unit cubes in a 3D arrangement
common_misconceptions: Not accounting for cubes behind others
question_patterns: How many cubes are in this structure?
How many cubes are hidden from view?
example_stems: This arrangement shows cubes stacked. How many cubes in total?
Looking at this structure, how many cubes can't you see?

concepts.name: Net Folding
concepts.description: Determining what 3D shape results when a 2D net is folded
common_misconceptions: Incorrectly tracking which faces become adjacent
Forgetting how patterns/letters transform when folded
question_patterns: Which cube can be made from this net?
When folded, which faces are opposite?
example_stems: This net has letters on each face. Which cube shows the correct arrangement?
Fold this net. Which pattern appears on the top when [face] is the base?

concepts.name: Rotation and Reflection
concepts.description: Identifying shapes after rotation or reflection transformations
common_misconceptions: Not accounting for direction of rotation
question_patterns: Which shape shows the original rotated 90° clockwise?
Which is the reflection of this shape?
example_stems: Rotate this L-shape 180°. What does it look like?
Reflect this arrow across the vertical line. Which option shows the result?

concepts.name: Shape Fitting and Puzzles
concepts.description: Determining which piece completes a puzzle or fits into a given space
common_misconceptions: Not checking all edges for fit
Forgetting rotation might help a piece fit
question_patterns: Which shape fits exactly into the gap?
example_stems: The puzzle is missing one piece. Which option completes it?
Which shape can be placed to make a rectangle?

concepts.name: Pattern Completion
concepts.description: Identifying the missing section of a pattern based on symmetry or repetition
question_patterns: Which piece completes the symmetric pattern?
What should go in the missing section?
example_stems: This pattern has 4-fold symmetry. What goes in the blank quadrant?
The design repeats. Which tile fills the gap?
